task.title: Repair The Mainspring
task.shortdesc: You can repair a typewriter mainspring by removing the mainspring housing and applying degreaser to clean the mainspring before reattaching the mainspring housing to your typewriter.

step.cmd: Remove the mainspring housing from the typewriter by unscrewing the two barrel attachment screws.
Set the mainspring housing on a rag, with the metal side of the barrel facing up.

step.note: Once degreaser reaches the mainspring, the barrel may jump or pop.
step.cmd: Using the pipette or dropper, apply two to three drops of degreaser on the center screw slot.
Use a stiff-bristle brush and a soft-bristle brush as needed to clean debris from the center screw.
Spray the barrel with compressed air to remove loosened debris.
Repeat steps 4 through 6 until the spring barrel rotates with ease.
Dry the barrel using a lint free cloth and compressed air.
Reattach the mainspring housing to the typewriter undercarriage by screwing in the two attachment screws.
Follow the steps in the section section titled "Reattach the drawband" to reattach the drawband to the mainspring housing.
